nh.nothing: Sorry, the page you requested cannot be opened temporarily, please try again later!

welcome.title: Nocalhost Web Dashboard
welcome.content: Manage users, clusters, applications and DevSpaces.

validation.confirm_password_error: The Confirm Password mast be equals The Password

overview.info: Nocalhost is an open-source IDE plugin for cloud-native applications development,Build, test and debug applications directly inside Kubernetes,providing the same debugging and developing experience you're used in the IDE even in the remote Kubernetes cluster,instantly sync your code change to remote container without rebuilding images or restarting containers.

user.info: User belongs to the independent concept of Nocalhost, it's different with user in Kubernetes. When you use Nocalhost Server and Nocalhost Plugins, User is used to identify your identity and access control to resources.

cluster.info: A Nocalhost Cluster is usually corresponds to a Kubernetes cluster. Nocalhost supports to manage multi cluster like TKE, ACK, CCE, GKE, ECS, Minikube, Kind, MicroK8s etc.

devspace.info: DevSpace is a concept of Nocalhost, which represents a pre-allocated development space managed by Nocalhost. Developers can deploy, uninstall, develop, and debug applications within DevSpace. DevSpaces are isolated from each other.

application.info: Application is a concept of Nocalhost, it is mainly used to manage a set of manifest files you want to apply for local development, it supports both Kubernetes manifest and helm chart. In other words, these manifests usually contain all the K8s resources that your own application depends on. If possible, we should try to keep it to a minimum.

bt.disabled: The current page does not support scaling

confirm.content: This will delete all nocalhost resources and created workspaces from the cluster.

tips.helm_repo: Application name will be used for release name
tips.helm_chart_name: Name will be used for chart name

delete.info: After deleting the application「{{name}}」, all resources of the application will be deleted.

deleteAuth.info: After the user cancels the authorization, he cannot access the application.

public.title: Are you sure you want to make the app public?
public.info: After the application 「{{name}}」 is made public, all resources of the application will be visible to users.

private.title: Are you sure you want to hide the app?
private.info: After the application 「{{name}}」 is made private, all resources of the application will not be visible to users.

fields.cluster_scope: This space has cluster resource permissions

fields.setAdminDesc: Set as a cluster administrator, the user has the right to add and edit users, clusters
fields.setLimitDesc: Setting the resource limit will limit the total resource usage of the current space, and the resource usage of the Container in each Pod in the current space will also be limited
fields.setBaseSpaceTip: Whether to set as the base development space
fields.setBaseSpaceDesc: Set as the base development space, add Istio sidecar automatic injection tags to the corresponding namespace

actions.resource_limit_not_implemented: Resource limit has not been implemented

confirm.title: Reset DevSpace
confirm.content: Reset DevSpace will delete [%{name}] namespace resource and create new namespace

document.vscode: Start coding with Nocalhost VSCode Plugin(Recemmended):
document.vscode_step1: Step 1: Install Nocalhost VSCode Plugin: Search nocalhost in the extension marketplace or click here:
document.vscode_step2: Step 2: Configure plugin and sigin nocalhost api server:
document.vscode_step2_1: Click Nocalhost Plugin Tab and click the button set api host: %{apiUrl}
document.vscode_step2_2: Click sign in to sigin nocalhost api server.
document.vscode_step3: Step 3: Install application and start development:
document.vscode_step3_1: Click the install icon of the application that you want to develop on the left panel.
document.vscode_step3_2: Click the Workload of this application to watch the deployment progress and wait for the installation.
document.vscode_step3_3: Click the start develop icon to enter DevSpace and enjoy your coding.
document.nhctl_step2: Step 2: Click 'Download Kubeconfig' and save this file
document.nhctl_step3: Step 3: Install an application that you  want to develop via nhctl:
document.nhctl_step3_1: # Click here to get more details about the arguments of nhctl
document.nhctl_step4: Step 4: Enter DevMode by specify a workload that you want to develop:
document.nhctl_step4_1: # Click here to get more details about the arguments of nhctl
document.nhctl_step4_2: nhctl dev start %{appName} --kubeconfig <the file you downloaded> -d <the workload that you want to develop>
document.nhctl_step5: Step 5: Sync codes to DevMode containers:
document.nhctl_step5_1: # Click here to get more details about the arguments of nhctl
document.nhctl_step5_2: nhctl sync %{appName} --kubeconfig <the file you downloaded> -d <the workload that you want to develop>
document.nhctl_step6: Step 6: Forward ports from DevMode container to local(Optional):
document.nhctl_step6_1: # Click here to get more details about the arguments of nhctl
document.nhctl_step6_2: nhctl port-forward %{appName} --kubeconfig <the file you downloaded> -d <the workload that you want to develop>
document.nhctl_step7: Step 7: Coding locally and start your program remotely:
document.nhctl_step7_1: # Click here to get more details about the arguments of nhctl
document.nhctl_step7_2: kubectl --kubeconfig <the file you downloaded> exec -it pod/<pod_name> -c nocalhost-dev -- bash

cancelShareO.cancelTitle: Are you sure you want to cancel sharing?
cancelShareO.cancelInfo: After unsharing, users will not be able to access the devspace

tips.deleteTitle: Are you sure you want to delete the development space?
tips.deleteContent: Deleting the development space will delete all resources in the {{name}} namespace.
tips.resetTitle: Are you sure you want to reset the development space?
tips.resetContent: Resetting the development space will delete all resources in the {{name}} namespace and rebuild.
tips.chooseType: Select the type of space to develop
tips.devSpaceDesc: A isolated DevSpace corresponds to one K8s namespace and they are isolated from each other, users have all the privileges of their own isolated DevSpace, and can share the isolated DevSpace privileges with other users.
tips.meshSpaceDesc: A shared DevSpace corresponds to a K8s namespace. The shared DevSpace is built based on the base DevSpace and shares the services of the base DevSpace; users have all the permissions of their own shared DevSpace and can share the shared DevSpace to other users.

meshSpace.selectCluster: Please select a cluster in the form on the left
meshSpace.selectBasicService: Select development services from the base development space
meshSpace.selectServiceTip: Select the application service to be developed from the base space, and the selected application service will be copied to the shared space
meshSpace.shareWorkloadTip: The shadow application copied from the base space, the traffic with header {{header}} in the basic space will be forwarded here
meshSpace.tracingHeaderTip: Please select Tracing Headers on the left, traffic with this header will be forwarded from the basic space to the shared space
meshSpace.selectBaseSpace: Please select the base development space
meshSpace.inputSpaceName: Please enter the development space name
